content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a hotel in Rome with a good rating (7 or above) that offers free cancellation and breakfast included, for a three-night stay from May 28 to May 31, 2026, for two adults.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first step is to enter the destination, "Rome", in the "Where are you going?" textbox to start the hotel search process.
Action: Type [14]; Rome
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to select dates for the stay, specifically May 28 to May 31, 2026. The calendar currently displays September and October 2025, so I need to navigate to May 2026 by clicking "Next month" until I reach the required month.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still need to reach May 2026, but currently the calendar is on October and November 2025. I should continue to click "Next month" to progress through the calendar.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing November and December 2025. I need to keep clicking "Next month" until reaching May 2026 to select the required dates.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows December 2025 and January 2026. I need to keep clicking "Next month" until I reach May 2026, as the desired check-in date is May 28, 2026.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.23
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows January and February 2026. I need to keep clicking "Next month" to reach May 2026 for the correct check-in and check-out dates.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.26
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows February and March 2026. May 2026 is still not visible, so I need to keep clicking "Next month" to reach the correct month for the booking dates.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows March and April 2026. I have not yet reached May 2026, so I need to keep clicking "Next month" to display the desired dates for check-in and check-out.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.33
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows April and May 2026. I can now select the check-in date (May 28, 2026) and check-out date (May 31, 2026), which are visible on the calendar.
Action: Click [87]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.37
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in date (May 28, 2026) is selected. Now, I need to select the check-out date (May 31, 2026), which is visible and corresponds to label [90].
Action: Click [90]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dates and number of guests are set correctly. Next, I need to filter search results for hotels with free cancellation and breakfast, and with a rating of 7 or above. These filter options are likely in the left sidebar but are not clearly visible. I should scroll down to reveal more filter options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Hotels" option is visible under "Property Type" (label [26]), which aligns with the requirement to find a hotel specifically (not apartments or other types). I should click "Hotels" to filter the results.
Action: Click [26]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results are now filtered to hotels only. To match all criteria, I still need to apply free cancellation and breakfast filters. The current filter section does not show these options, so I need to scroll down to reveal more filtering choices.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.58
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The sidebar is still displaying property types and basic facilities but does not yet show filters for "Free cancellation" or "Breakfast included." I need to scroll down further to access these additional filter options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The property rating and review score filters are now visible, but options like "Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included" are still not displayed. I need to scroll further down to access all filters under "Facilities" and other sections.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Good: 7+" review score filter is now visible. Applying this will ensure only hotels with a review score of 7 or above are shown, aligning with the task requirements. 
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filters for rating 7+ and hotel type are active, but options for "Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included" are not yet visible. I need to scroll down the filter sidebar further to look for these specific popular filters.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.75
